data.title: Nice little down town bar and restaurant
data.text: Looking for a place to have Dinner, we found this Location. Friendly staff good Food. The wine was delicious.

data.title: Best food in Kenosha!
data.text: The food and wine are awesome!  We got a quesadilla appetizer that made us moan!  It was the best we'd ever eaten.  Our food was delicious and plentiful, and the house wine was way better than what you get elsewhere.  The young staff seemed not only capable, but had a finess that only comes through correct training.  Even the toddler with us was treated wonderfully!

data.title: Brilliant execution of their entrees, wide variety of nicely-priced wines
data.text: I had the duck three ways, my dining partner had the filet.  Among the best executed meals we've had.  Great flavors and cooked and plated to perfection.  The wine recommendations were also great, I had three 3oz selections recommended by the server and all were great compliments to the meal.  We'll be back for sure!

data.title: Great dimming experience
data.text: Really enjoyed the experience and atmosphere. Food was fun and delicious. Menu had a wonderful variety of options to for everyone.

data.title: Nice place a little more trendy which attracts the younger crowd sometimes but have seen all ages over the years!!!
data.text: Typically nicer downtown Kenosha restaurants are hot for a few months then fizzle out and go out of business. Wine Knot has been there for years now and always do a real good job and manage to stay in business when most do not. This itself should tell you stop by and have a nice meal. Beautiful outdoor seating during our roughly 5 months of decent weather, nice dining room also for cold winter months or if too hot and humid. Best part is the food is very good and a nice wine selection!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

data.title: Dinner with friends
data.text:
Really enjoyed this restaurant. The food was awesome and the service was superb!we were able to sit at a table outside 
The macadamia nut encrusted halibut was superb! The meatloaf is also a delicious choice. The prices are reasonable. I would definitely recommend this restaurant!

data.title: Chef Brian is Amazing!!
data.text: This place is really Kenosha's first wine focused upscale dining. A few others have popped up in the recent years but Wine Knot has stayed and slayed. The food here is crazy good. Just get in early, their kitchen closes at 830

data.title: Bring your guests/dates here!
data.text: This restaurant is becoming a Kenosha standard for me. I enjoy meeting business associates or travelers here. The food is simple and elegant, well prepared and high quality. Don't miss this great place, and don't forget to check out the menus to get a feel for the local flavor of events and activities in the Downtown!

data.title: Great salads
data.text: Wine Knot Bar and Bistro continues to be one of the best fusion restaurants in Kenosha.  Nice outdoor seating with heat lamps.  I only wish that the Wine Knot was opened of brunch on Saturday during the Farmers' Market.

data.title: Excellent Choice
data.text: This is one of my favorite places to dine. Let me start with the wait staff. All of the servers are fantastic.  They are knowledgeable about the food and the many wines they serve. I have never had a server that wasn't upbeat and friendly.There are many times on a weekend that there is a wait time but not usually more than 30 minutes. In the summer time there is an outdoor seating area that is fun and inviting. My boyfriend and I love their different menu. My favorite tapas has to be the Apple Bacon Blue Cheese Pizza. Perfectly done. If you are a fan of salmon the Sriracha Dusted Salmon is superb for dinner as well as Brian's meatloaf. They change their menu a couple times a year as well but always have Brian's meatloaf and the Macadamia Crusted Halibut (their house favorite and truly one of mine as well.) The bartenders are great and love to please. You truly can not go wrong with your dining experience at the Wine Knot. Great for any occasion and you will always feel welcomed there.

data.title: Great Butter Chicken Curry
data.text: Visited this place many times but this week saw Butter Chicken Curry (Indian) on the menu. This was amazing! I am a real curry fan having grown up on it when I lived in England - but this curry was better than many I've tasted in actual Indian restaurants I've visited here in the US! Hats off to the chef, great job!!!

data.title: One of our hometown favorites!
data.text: Wine Knot never disappoints; good choice for cocktails and appetizers or a great dinner.  The filet is excellent as is the halibut (known as the house favorite).  All of the servers are excellent and go out of their way to ensure a great dining experience.  The bar staff is also excellent and are great at suggesting new wines to try or coming up with a great cocktail.  I never thought I would order meatloaf in a restaurant, but this is an exception -it's excellent!  The menu changes a couple times a year, but the filet, halibut and meatloaf are all constants.

data.title: Superb dining experience
data.text: The homemade meatloaf was a favorite at our table. The bread served before the meal is excellent. They went out of their way to find us a table on a busy Friday night.

data.title: Over priced and limited choices
data.text: The drink specials are great, but the food choices are limited and over priced. There is only one thing on the menu that I will order because the other choices are so unappealing.

data.title: Tasty and great cocktails!
data.text: Our visit got off to a rocky start when our reservation was not recorded.  We had called to inquire about a wine tasting and decided to make reservations, the old fashioned way, phone and person answering call. They have a online system and it will use next time. We were going to a show so our reserved time was important. The staff were apologetic and did find us a seat in the bar area. Not bad as the ambiance is quite nice. The food was tasty and reasonably priced. I recommend the oxtail stuffed mushrooms for appetizers. Savory and yummy... the cocktail menu was  unique and I sensed the skill of a bar chef feel versus bartender.  Wished we would have had time to try others. The food came out quickly and our server was knowledgeable and quick.  He even made our drinks. We returned later that evening as a band was playing. They were very good and the staff even remembered us from earlier in the evening. Overall a very good experience and we would return!

data.title: Menu a bit challenging
data.text: Went on a Monday night and very quiet decor very nice. Entrance door had to cross a covering of ice from a few days prior to my visit. I inquired about the onion soup but it was in a pocket. Inquired about the duck Brest but it was a pulled breast. Salmon was coated in salsa. The waitress was getting annoyed with me at this point. I ordered the shank which was presented well but the meat was dry. I would have liked another glass of wine but the waitress was too busy talking to the other staff.

data.title: Not just a wine bar
data.text: Everything from the mashed potatoes & squeaky green beans to the fish was done to perfection. The desert topped off the meal and made this one of our favorites in the area.

data.title: A Surprisingly Good Kenosha Bistro
data.text:
Who woulda thunk that a bistro in Kenosha serving dishes like a seafood stew and halibut would be this good.....but oh it is!  Only blocks from the lake in a cute section of town, Wine Knot is a great spot to bring friends and family for a beverage, apps, or the entire meal. 

I recently visited the Knot with work colleagues and we had a lovely time.  The wine list has plenty of standards but I especially liked the fact that there are delicious eclectic choices such as a Spanish Albariño or a Chilean Carmenere.  These are terrific food wines that aren't as well known but as a result they are reasonably priced and worth a try.  

We tried and enjoyed a number of apps. Some favorites were the pizza, the spinach and artichoke dip, and the fries.  For entrees the halibut is a house favorite and it was a hit with a couple in our crew.  The seafood stew was excellent (do add the jalapeños, cilantro and radishes to the dish - liberally for a great kick!).  The flat iron steak was a hit and it wasn't as "flat" as some speculated.  Some of the sides, such as the brussel sprouts were given big thumbs up.  

Service was excellent and our server gave some great advice on dishes to try.  We did try a couple desserts and they were also excellent. My favorite was the peanut butter and chocolate special but the chocolate pyramid was also good. 

All in the Knot was a lovely surprise and we all went home satiated and happy.  Give the Wine Knot a try and you won't be disappointed.

data.title: Great place for an intimate evening meal!
data.text: I have been to the Wine Knot several times, and have always had a wonderful meal with attentive service and

data.title: Great Spot!
data.text: This place has only gotten better over the years and the food is fantastic. The bar staff is knows's their wine/booze as well. Always crowded for a reason.
